title: Churkin
author: Churkin
created_time: September 13, 2022, 12:08:41 PMLast edit: September 13, 2022, 12:43:03 PM by Churkin
content: BRINGA.ME - P2P COURIER SERVICEEarn bitcoin by delivering parcels. Send packages of any size in New York city with same-day door-to-door delivery in three clicks.https://bringa.meStart earning in your spare time with New York Express Delivery. Choose how much time you want to spend delivering packages and get paid up to 0.0088096 BTC per day. ($200 / day)

comments.author: Churkin
comments.body: Hi there!We have launched a service for the delivery of any parcels and cargoes where the logic is based on BlockchainNow the service is operating in New York, we would like to receive feedback to improve the service.

comments.author: ABCbits
comments.body: Quote from: Churkin on September 13, 2022, 12:08:41 PMStart earning in your spare time with New York Express Delivery. Choose how much time you want to spend delivering packages and get paid up to 0,000054 BTC per day. By any chance, did you write wrong amount of BTC people could earn? 0.000054BTC/5400 satoshi (about $1.12) seems very low on New York which have minimum wage $13.20/hour.

comments.author: Churkin
comments.body: Quote from: ETFbitcoin on September 13, 2022, 12:34:09 PMQuote from: Churkin on September 13, 2022, 12:08:41 PMStart earning in your spare time with New York Express Delivery. Choose how much time you want to spend delivering packages and get paid up to 0,000054 BTC per day. By any chance, did you write wrong amount of BTC people could earn? 0.000054BTC/5400 satoshi (about $1.12) seems very low on New York which have minimum wage $13.20/hour.Oh, I was really wrong, thanks for the feedback, couriers can earn from $ 200 a day working full time (~ 0.0088096 BTC )

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: Quote from: Churkin on September 13, 2022, 12:42:30 PMOh, I was really wrong, thanks for the feedback, couriers can earn from $ 200 a day working full time (~ 0.0088096 BTC )All I am getting right now is login page for creating my order, and that's about it, so is there any page on your website with more information about your service?You are paying people directly with Bitcoin, and that Bitcoin is held in custodial or non-custodial wallets?There should be some FAQ page and same for Privacy Policy.I see Churkin account recently woke up, and one more issue I noticed is that domain is registered from Russia, so I would be very careful with this:QuoteOrganization:Alexsei ChurkinState:Samarskaja obl.Country:RUDomain Name: BRINGA.MERegistry Domain ID: D425500000339782910-AGRSRegistrar WHOIS Server: whois.regtime.netRegistrar URL: http://webnames.ruUpdated Date: 2022-09-09T13:20:06ZCreation Date: 2022-07-31T19:25:07ZRegistry Expiry Date: 2023-07-31T19:25:07Zhttps://www.whois.com/whois/bringa.me

comments.author: examplens
comments.body: Quote from: dkbit98 on September 13, 2022, 07:35:52 PMQuote from: Churkin on September 13, 2022, 12:42:30 PMOh, I was really wrong, thanks for the feedback, couriers can earn from $ 200 a day working full time (~ 0.0088096 BTC )All I am getting right now is login page for creating my order, and that's about it, so is there any page on your website with more information about your service?You are paying people directly with Bitcoin, and that Bitcoin is held in custodial or non-custodial wallets?There should be some FAQ page and same for Privacy Policy.The title says: "Decentralized courier service", I am quite curious, what exactly makes this service decentralized? one person who will send bitcoin earnings to couriers?Quote from: dkbit98 on September 13, 2022, 07:35:52 PMI see Churkin account recently woke up, and one more issue I noticed is that domain is registered from Russia, so I would be very careful with this:QuoteUpdated Date: 2022-09-09T13:20:06ZCreation Date: 2022-07-31T19:25:07ZRegistry Expiry Date: 2023-07-31T19:25:07ZI would say more than careful, the domain is less than two months old.

comments.author: Churkin
comments.body: Quote from: dkbit98 on September 13, 2022, 07:35:52 PMQuote from: Churkin on September 13, 2022, 12:42:30 PMOh, I was really wrong, thanks for the feedback, couriers can earn from $ 200 a day working full time (~ 0.0088096 BTC )All I am getting right now is login page for creating my order, and that's about it, so is there any page on your website with more information about your service?You are paying people directly with Bitcoin, and that Bitcoin is held in custodial or non-custodial wallets?There should be some FAQ page and same for Privacy Policy.I see Churkin account recently woke up, and one more issue I noticed is that domain is registered from Russia, so I would be very careful with this:QuoteOrganization:Alexsei ChurkinState:Samarskaja obl.Country:RUDomain Name: BRINGA.MERegistry Domain ID: D425500000339782910-AGRSRegistrar WHOIS Server: whois.regtime.netRegistrar URL: http://webnames.ruUpdated Date: 2022-09-09T13:20:06ZCreation Date: 2022-07-31T19:25:07ZRegistry Expiry Date: 2023-07-31T19:25:07Zhttps://www.whois.com/whois/bringa.meThanks for the feedback.Happy to answer all questions:All I am getting right now is login page for creating my order, and that's about it, so is there any page on your website with more information about your service?You can log in as a customer to create an order or as a courier if you want to make money on deliveryThere is no additional information yet, but it will appear soon, for this purpose I specially created this threadYou pay for delivery directly to the courier by any 4 methods:1) Bitcoin2) Cash.3) In cash upon receipt of the order.4) sending money (for example, Cash App or PayPal)It is secureThere should be some FAQ page and same for Privacy Policy.Here is Privacy Policy: https://bringa.me/privacyPolicyFAQ coming soon (about 2-3 days)You are paying people directly with Bitcoin, and that Bitcoin is held in custodial or non-custodial wallets?Â We have a cargo delivery service in the state of New York and the customer pays for the execution of an order for the delivery of a certain cargo directly to the courier through the cache or through a banking application.Bitcoin in our service is used only by couriers to insure their delivery orders. The price of the order insurance is specified by the customer when creating an application for additional insurance. For example, in the case of ordering the delivery of a bouquet of flowers with insurance of $5, an amount of $5 will be deducted from the courier's account for the duration of the order, after completing this order, the courier will return it $5 and our commission for the completed order will be deducted 10% of the delivery amountWe do not create bitcoin wallets for couriers, we do not store them. Bitcoin is used as a way to deposit money into our system, to insure parcels. Now we are creating a FAQ for a better explanation of how the Bringa courier service worksI see Churkin account recently woke up, and one more issue I noticed is that domain is registered from Russia, so I would be very careful with thisI took a short break after our last project development (I publish all my startups here) and have now returned to give community something new and get feedback from the communityThe system is completely secure and I think it's easy to check.I will wait for more feedback, and will be back soon with an interesting update

comments.author: joniboini
comments.body: There's so little info on the website if you're not planning to order or register as a courier. I think it is fair to say that at least a dedicated homepage for scrolling around your website would be better. At least it will look less scammy. That aside, is this New York Express Delivery your own company and a new one too? I can't find any info about it.

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: Quote from: Churkin on September 13, 2022, 08:32:00 PMI took a short break after our last project development (I publish all my startups here) and have now returned to give community something new and get feedback from the communitySure, anyone can take a break in forum and be inactive for some time.Problem is that I don't understand how someone located in Russia can run and operate business with app that works in New York city and United States.Do you have any office and people who work in New York city or everything is done as a virtual startup?

comments.author: Churkin
comments.body: Quote from: joniboini on September 14, 2022, 10:12:51 AMThere's so little info on the website if you're not planning to order or register as a courier. I think it is fair to say that at least a dedicated homepage for scrolling around your website would be better. At least it will look less scammy. That aside, is this New York Express Delivery your own company and a new one too? I can't find any info about it.Thanks for the feedbackYou are right, we want to add more information as the service develops, at the moment we have already created for this:Question and answer for the courier: https://bringa.me/courierFaqQuestion and answer for the customer: https://bringa.me/customerFaqWe are not going to stop there, and as the service develops, we will add additional informationAn Android app will be released soon, we are currently undergoing moderation at Google, I will definitely post a link to it here when it comes outBringa is our company, now we are going through the business registration procedure, this process takes some time. I will definitely let you know when this process is completed.Quote from: dkbit98 on September 14, 2022, 05:06:47 PMQuote from: Churkin on September 13, 2022, 08:32:00 PMI took a short break after our last project development (I publish all my startups here) and have now returned to give community something new and get feedback from the communitySure, anyone can take a break in forum and be inactive for some time.Problem is that I don't understand how someone located in Russia can run and operate business with app that works in New York city and United States.Do you have any office and people who work in New York city or everything is done as a virtual startup?Well, i don't see a problem in the fact that I can live in different countries and register domains from any countries, I have plans to introduce everyone closer to our team.Most of the team is located in New York, and I have lived there for almost half of my life and continue to live there, I will be happy to tell you about myself and the people who create BringaWe have an office in New York, and our goal is to help deliver parcels quickly and safely, and to earn couriers.I will be glad to receive feedback

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: Quote from: Churkin on September 14, 2022, 08:36:19 PMWell, i don't see a problem in the fact that I can live in different countries and register domains from any countries, I have plans to introduce everyone closer to our team.It wouldn't be a problem in normal circumstances, but situation we have in the world today is not normal and we could easily see accounts and funds being frozen just because of person nationality.If we add there Bitcoin and cryptocurrency, there could be a bunch of other issues with regulators, especially in New York city that has very strict financial and Bitcoin regulation.Someone from US can correct me if I was wrong with anything said before, so yeah I want to see more information about team because I am a bit suspicious.

comments.author: SFR10
comments.body: Quote from: Churkin on September 13, 2022, 08:32:00 PMYou pay for delivery directly to the courier by any 4 methods:1) BitcoinI'm only seeing three methods on your "Customer FAQ" page and Bitcoin isn't one of them... I hope it's just a mistake and not a workaround for not acquiring the bitlicense!Quote from: Churkin on September 13, 2022, 08:32:00 PMBitcoin in our service is used only by couriers to insure their delivery orders.Based on the above quote, this isn't the only way Bitcoin is used in your services!

comments.author: Churkin
comments.body: Quote from: SFR10 on September 15, 2022, 06:08:32 PMQuote from: Churkin on September 13, 2022, 08:32:00 PMYou pay for delivery directly to the courier by any 4 methods:1) BitcoinI'm only seeing three methods on your "Customer FAQ" page and Bitcoin isn't one of them... I hope it's just a mistake and not a workaround for not acquiring the bitlicense!Quote from: Churkin on September 13, 2022, 08:32:00 PMBitcoin in our service is used only by couriers to insure their delivery orders.Based on the above quote, this isn't the only way Bitcoin is used in your services!Thanks for the question, if you don't mind, I'd like to explain:This is one of the methods that the courier can offer when he comes to you. If it's convenient for you.On our side, we offer only 3 options with no alternatives. This can be seen if you register as a client.

comments.author: Churkin
comments.body: Hello all friends!I am glad to announce that we have released a mobile application for Android!https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.bringa.appWith Bringa you can send parcels, and as couriers you can earn money on delivery. When you need to quickly and safely pass someone any things, such as documents, medicine, food, clothes, flowers, you can make an order in Bringa and the nearest courier will pick up your order.Join UsFacebook: https://www.facebook.com/bringa.meLinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/88635732/

comments.author: burugcrypto
comments.body: I liked your project very much. More of like this projects should come . I have two questions.1 - Is there any threshold for payments? If not, How do you manage micro payments? One person not working full time only worked one or two orders per day which on his way to home or office.2 - Many people manage businesses from outside USA. Thatâs common.You registered domain in Russia. Are you russian? Because some countries don't trust certain country people because political issues. USA - Russia , India - Pakistan etc for examples.

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: Quote from: burugcrypto on October 09, 2022, 07:21:57 AM1 - Is there any threshold for payments? If not, How do you manage micro payments? One person not working full time only worked one or two orders per day which on his way to home or office. They don't mention any thresholds in their Courier FAQ page and since they talk about flexible schedules, it wouldn't make sense having such limitations. The work isn't flexible if you need to respect certain working hours. You work when it's ok for you. The company takes a 10% commission from each delivery.
